items.title: Show HN: We built an AI Humanizer to fix unnatural AI writing
items.summary:
Most AI-written text isn’t obviously wrong.
Grammar is fine. Facts are usually fine.
What gives it away is the tone. We kept seeing the same patterns: sentences with identical rhythm, over-explained transitions, and a kind of “smoothness” that doesn’t match how people actually write. AI detectors try to flag these patterns, but chasing detectors felt like treating the symptom, not the cause. So we built a small AI Humanizer that works at the sentence level. Instead of masking signals or applying prompt tricks, it rewrites text to improve flow, vary structure, and reduce repetition — aiming for writing that simply reads more naturally. The tool doesn’t try to guarantee that text will pass any specific detector. Different detectors behave differently, and that changes all the time. Our goal was narrower: make AI-assisted writing feel intentional and human-readable again. This started as an internal experiment while working on AI detection, and we decided to make it public to see how others approach the same problem. Link: https://dechecker.ai/ai-humanizer Would love feedback, especially from people who write a lot with AI or build NLP tools. Comments URL: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=46362880 Points: 1 # Comments: 0

items.title: Lumina – a minimal AI reflection app (source code available)
items.summary: I built Lumina, a small AI-powered reflection and journaling app focused on simplicity and privacy. It helps users explore thoughts through structured prompts and summaries rather than social features or gamification. I’m looking to sell the full source code with a commercial license to a solo dev or small team who wants a solid base to build on. Comments URL: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=46360921 Points: 1 # Comments: 0
